description: First attested in 1548. From Middle French cimeterre (15c.) or directly from Italian scimitarra, possibly from an unknown Ottoman Turkish word, ultimately from Persian شمشیر‎ (šamšir, “sword”). Doublet of shamshir.

entries.meaning: A sword of Persian origin that features a curved blade.

verbs.description: scimitar (third-person singular simple present scimitars, present participle scimitaring, simple past and past participle scimitared)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To strike or slice with, or as if with, a scimitar.
